page.title: 11The Cromford Canal
page.content: On Friday 7th June,1985 we visited the Cromford Canal.The Canal is 14 miles long,but only about 2 miles are now navigable.Our class went for a ride in a restored horse_drawn narrow boat called John Gray.The narrow boat was about 11 metres long and weighed about half a ton.The boat could carry 50 people at a speed of about 2 miles per hour. At the Wharf there were 2 horses,one of which,Tina,was used to pull the narrow boat.The horse had a special harness to help it pull the narrow boat.The horses were bred especially for pulling heavy loads(up to 5 tons!) We travelled for 2 miles along the canal as far as the Leawood pump house.The Canal was full of interesting wildlife including moorhens,coots,water voles,and a nesting grebe.
